intro: Pipturus oahuensis, commonly known as Oahu hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
